quotes.message: Talents, to strike the eye of posterity, should be concentrated: rays powerless while they are scattered, burn in a point.
quotes.name: Robert Eldridge Aris Willmott

quotes.message: Talent is a dreadfully cheap commodity, cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: A talent somewhat above mediocrity, shrewd and not too sensitive, is more likely to rise in the world than genius.
quotes.name: Charles Cooley

quotes.message: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: Every man has his own vocation, talent is the call.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: I'd rather have a lot of talent and a little experience than a lot of experience and a little talent.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: Talent isn't genius, and no amount of energy can make it so. I want to be great, or nothing. I won't be a commonplace dauber, so I don't intend to try any more.
quotes.name: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.message: Everybody is talented because everybody who is human has something to express.
quotes.name: Brenda Ueland

quotes.message: Talent is a matter of quantity. Talent does not write on page, it writes three hundred.
quotes.name: Jules Renard

quotes.message: Your talent determines what you can do. Your motivation determines how much you are willing to do. Your attitude determines how well you do it.
quotes.name: Lou Holtz

quotes.message: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
quotes.name: Erica Jong

quotes.message: Everyone has talent at twenty-five. The difficulty is to have it at fifty.
quotes.name: Edgar Degas

quotes.message: Talent without working hard is nothing.
quotes.name: Cristiano Ronaldo

quotes.message: However you make your living is where your talent lies.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: If you ever find that you're the most talented person in the room, you need to find another room.
quotes.name: Austin Kleon

quotes.message: Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Never confuse the size of your paycheck with the size of your talent.
quotes.name: Marlon Brando

quotes.message: Talent is a dull knife that will cut nothing unless it is wielded with great force.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: Talent for talent's sake is a bauble and a show. Talent working with joy in the cause of universal truth lifts the possessor to new power as a benefactor.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: We must believe that we are gifted for something, and that this thing, at whatever cost, must be attained.
quotes.name: Marie Curie

quotes.message: It takes little talent to see clearly what lies under one's nose, a good deal of it to know in which direction to point that organ.
quotes.name: W. H. Auden

quotes.message: This is how I define talent; it is a gift that God has given us in secret, which we reveal without knowing it.
quotes.name: Montesquieu

quotes.message: Talent is a tenant in the house owned by genius.
quotes.name: Austin O'Malley

quotes.message: Talent is never static. It's always growing or dying.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: There are two kinds of talent, man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent you have to work very hard. With God-given talent, you just touch it up once in a while.
quotes.name: Pearl Bailey

quotes.message: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
quotes.name: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.message: The idea that talent is directly proportional to your trophy cabinet is one I oppose.
quotes.name: Alex Turner

quotes.message: Talent is nothing but a prolonged period of attention and a shortened period of mental assimilation.
quotes.name: Constantin Stanislavski

quotes.message: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.name: Henry Van Dyke

quotes.message: Talent means nothing, while experience, acquired in humility and with hard work, means everything.
quotes.name: Patrick SÃ¼skind

quotes.message: The most gifted natures are perhaps also the most trembling.
quotes.name: Andre Gide

quotes.message: Talent is always conscious of its own abundance, and does not object to sharing.
quotes.name: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quotes.message: It is a happy talent to know how to play.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me.
quotes.name: Erma Bombeck

quotes.message: In the battle of existence, Talent is the punch; Tact is the clever footwork.
quotes.name: Wilson Mizner

quotes.message: We are told that talent creates its own opportunities. But it sometimes seems that intense desire creates not only its own opportunities but its own talents.
quotes.name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.message: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all the virtues are of no avail.
quotes.name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.message: Artistic talent is a gift from God and whoever discovers it in himself has a certain obligation: to know that he cannot waste this talent, but must develop it.
quotes.name: Pope John Paul II

quotes.message: Access to talented and creative people is to modern business what access to coal and iron ore was to steel-making.
quotes.name: Richard Florida

quotes.message: The greatest talents often lie buried out of sight.
quotes.name: Plautus

quotes.message: Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: I believe that every person is born with talent.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: Not he deserves praise that has talents, but he that uses them.
quotes.name: Ivan Panin

quotes.message: It's not the act of arrogance to draw, it's humbling you must use your God-given talent. And of all the people I sketch, in most cases I feel I have to measure up to the subject.
quotes.name: LeRoy Neiman
